name: The 'Low Maintenance' Bamboo Forest
description: Client insisted on bamboo for 'easy care'. Now their neighbor's yard is also a bamboo forest. Surprise!
design_notes: We recommended containment barriers. They declined. The lawsuit should be fun.

name: The 'Why Is My Water Bill So High?' Project
description: Lush English garden installed in Arizona desert. Currently using more water than the entire neighborhood combined.
design_notes: Client wanted 'that green look'. We suggested astroturf. They called us 'unimaginative'.

name: The 'I Want Color Year-Round' Fantasy
description: Installed 17 varieties that bloom in different seasons. Looks spectacular for 3 days each year and terrible the other 362.
design_notes: Nature doesn't work like a Pinterest board, Karen.

name: The 'No Bees Please' Paradox
description: Client wanted flowers but 'no bugs'. Created a beautiful silk flower arrangement. Real ones would attract bees. Duh.
design_notes: Explained pollination. Client suggested we 'find flowers that don't do that'.

name: The 'Toddler Run' Redesign
description: Replaced delicate perennials with indestructible shrubs after client's child used the garden as a stomping ground.
design_notes: Should have just installed a bounce house and called it a day.

name: The 'Too Much Money' Water Feature
description: Seven-tiered fountain with LED lighting and imported Italian marble. Neighbors hate the constant splashing sounds.
design_notes: Client's request: 'Make it look like the Bellagio but for squirrels'.

name: The 'Native Plants' Charade
description: Client insisted on 100% native species... then demanded we include hydrangeas, roses, and other decidedly non-native plants.
design_notes: We drew the line at palm trees. This is Minnesota.

name: The 'Privacy Hedge' That Won't Grow
description: Planted tiny arborvitae that will provide privacy in approximately 27 years. Neighbors can currently watch you shower.
design_notes: Client refused mature plants because 'they cost too much'. Enjoy your fishbowl existence!

name: The 'We Have Perfect Soil' Debacle
description: Client swore their soil was amazing. Our testing revealed concrete runoff, motor oil, and the shattered dreams of previous gardeners.
design_notes: Installed raised beds filled with actual soil. Client complained about the cost.

name: The 'But It's Organic!' Nightmare
description: Client refused all pest control methods except positive vibes and essential oils. Plants currently being devoured by aphids.
design_notes: We offered to bless the garden with crystals. They said yes unironically.

name: The 'I'll Do the Maintenance' Lie
description: Designed intricate formal garden with client's assurance they'd handle upkeep. Received panicked call about 'plant things needing stuff' two weeks later.
design_notes: Now on speed dial for 'what's this weed?' texts at 7am.

name: The 'Dog-Safe' Garden
description: Every plant non-toxic to canines. Unfortunately, Fido prefers to snack on the teak benches and irrigation system.
design_notes: Should have made the whole thing out of Nylabones.

name: The 'Drought-Tolerant' Swamp
description: Installed xeriscaping, then client overwatered obsessively. Now hosting the only cactus in history to die of root rot.
design_notes: Installed 'this plant needs neglect' signs. Client waters them daily.

name: The 'Butterfly Garden' (Spiders Included)
description: Lush plants to attract pollinators. Also attracted every spider within three miles. Client shocked that nature includes bugs.
design_notes: Client asked if we could make butterflies without caterpillars. We laughed. They were serious.

name: The 'Fast-Growing' Vine Disaster
description: Installed beautiful ivy that has now consumed the shed, two trees, and possibly a small pet. Client can't find their house.
design_notes: Should have specified that 'fast-growing' isn't just marketing speak.

name: The 'Shade Garden' in Full Sun
description: Client insisted on hostas and ferns... in their south-facing yard. They're now the crispiest plants in the neighborhood.
design_notes: Explained sun requirements. Client said 'but they're so pretty'. RIP.

name: The 'Low-Light Indoor Jungle' Delusion
description: Apartment with two north-facing windows now filled with dying tropical plants. Client waters them with tears.
design_notes: Recommended grow lights. Client wanted 'all natural'. Nature said no.

name: The 'Child-Friendly' Yard
description: Soft artificial turf, rounded edges, safe plants. Kids exclusively play inside with iPads.
design_notes: Should have just projected a nature screensaver on the wall.

name: The 'I Want a Lawn But Also Hate Mowing' Paradox
description: Installed perfect Kentucky bluegrass. Client now complains about having to mow weekly. Astroturf looking better every day.
design_notes: Grass grows. This is not our fault.

name: The 'Deer-Proof' Buffet
description: Used every deer-resistant plant in the catalog. Deer, being illiterate, ate them all anyway.
design_notes: Client asked for 'deer-proof' plants. We explained these don't exist. They insisted.

name: The 'Winter Interest' Sadness
description: Beautiful seed heads and ornamental grasses left standing for winter beauty. Client says it 'just looks dead'.
design_notes: Explained seasons. Client suggested we find plants that 'stay pretty' year-round.

name: The 'Too Many Colors' Rainbow Explosion
description: Client refused to choose a color scheme. The result looks like a clown's idea of a garden. Neighbors wear sunglasses.
design_notes: We suggested cohesion. Client said 'I like all the colors'. Mission accomplished.

name: The 'Small Tree' That Wasn't
description: Planted 'dwarf' variety that's now 25 feet tall and growing through power lines. Nursery claims 'it must be happy here'.
design_notes: Client refuses to prune because 'it's natural'. Power company disagrees.

name: The 'Instant Mature Garden' Fantasy
description: Client wanted 'full and lush' immediately without paying for mature plants. Now staring at sad little sprouts and disappointment.
design_notes: Explained that gardens grow. Client asked if we could 'speed it up'.

name: The 'No Chemicals' Battlefield
description: Organic garden currently losing war against every pest in the county. Japanese beetles throwing parties in the roses.
design_notes: Client refuses to intervene because 'nature will balance itself'. Nature is currently drunk and destructive.

name: The 'I Changed My Mind' Redesign
description: Third complete overhaul this year. Current theme: 'English cottage meets Japanese zen with desert succulents'. It's a crime against horticulture.
design_notes: Started charging 'indecision fees'. Client paid without blinking.
